snippet: Unemployment levels in the United States have dropped back almost to the levels of fall 2008, but Europe has a grimmer story.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column says number of unemployed workers in United States has fallen back mostly to levels of September 2008, when global credit crisis was triggered by collapse of Lehman Brothers; notes unemployment totals remain higher in most European countries, with exception of Germany.
lead_paragraph: Unemployment levels in the United States have dropped back almost to the levels of fall 2008, but Europe has a grimmer story.

headline.print_headline: U.S. and European Job Markets Take Different Paths
headline.main: U.S. and European Job Markets Take Different Paths
